panda.codec.binary

Class Base32

  • java.lang.Object
    • panda.codec.binary.BaseNCodec
      • panda.codec.binary.Base32
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BinaryDecoder, BinaryEncoder, Decoder, Encoder

    public class Base32
extends BaseNCodec
    Provides Base32 encoding and decoding as defined by RFC 4648.

    The class can be parameterized in the following manner with various constructors:

    • Whether to use the "base32hex" variant instead of the default "base32"
    • Line length: Default 76. Line length that aren't multiples of 8 will still essentially end up being multiples of 8 in the encoded data.
    • Line separator: Default is CRLF ("\r\n")

    This class operates directly on byte streams, and not character streams.

    This class is thread-safe.

    See Also:
    RFC 4648

        public Base32()

        When encoding the line length is 0 (no chunking).

      • Base32

        public Base32(int lineLength)
        Creates a Base32 codec used for decoding and encoding.

        When encoding the line length is given in the constructor, the line separator is CRLF.

        Parameters:
        lineLength - Each line of encoded data will be at most of the given length (rounded down to nearest multiple of 8). If lineLength <= 0, then the output will not be divided into lines (chunks). Ignored when decoding.

      • Base32

        public Base32(int lineLength,
      byte[] lineSeparator)
        Creates a Base32 codec used for decoding and encoding.

        When encoding the line length and line separator are given in the constructor.

        Line lengths that aren't multiples of 8 will still essentially end up being multiples of 8 in the encoded data.

        Parameters:
        lineLength - Each line of encoded data will be at most of the given length (rounded down to nearest multiple of 8). If lineLength <= 0, then the output will not be divided into lines (chunks). Ignored when decoding.
        lineSeparator - Each line of encoded data will end with this sequence of bytes.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - The provided lineSeparator included some Base32 characters. That's not going to work!

      • Base32

        public Base32(int lineLength,
      byte[] lineSeparator,
      boolean useHex)
        Creates a Base32 / Base32 Hex codec used for decoding and encoding.

        When encoding the line length and line separator are given in the constructor.

        Line lengths that aren't multiples of 8 will still essentially end up being multiples of 8 in the encoded data.

        Parameters:
        lineLength - Each line of encoded data will be at most of the given length (rounded down to nearest multiple of 8). If lineLength <= 0, then the output will not be divided into lines (chunks). Ignored when decoding.
        lineSeparator - Each line of encoded data will end with this sequence of bytes.
        useHex - if true, then use Base32 Hex alphabet, otherwise use Base32 alphabet
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - The provided lineSeparator included some Base32 characters. That's not going to work! Or the lineLength > 0 and lineSeparator is null.

      • Base32

        public Base32(int lineLength,
      byte[] lineSeparator,
      boolean useHex,
      byte pad)
        Creates a Base32 / Base32 Hex codec used for decoding and encoding.

        When encoding the line length and line separator are given in the constructor.

        Line lengths that aren't multiples of 8 will still essentially end up being multiples of 8 in the encoded data.

        Parameters:
        lineLength - Each line of encoded data will be at most of the given length (rounded down to nearest multiple of 8). If lineLength <= 0, then the output will not be divided into lines (chunks). Ignored when decoding.
        lineSeparator - Each line of encoded data will end with this sequence of bytes.
        useHex - if true, then use Base32 Hex alphabet, otherwise use Base32 alphabet
        pad - byte used as padding byte.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - The provided lineSeparator included some Base32 characters. That's not going to work! Or the lineLength > 0 and lineSeparator is null.

        public boolean isInAlphabet(byte octet)

        Specified by:
        isInAlphabet in class BaseNCodec
        Parameters:
        octet - The value to test
        Returns:
        true if the value is defined in the the Base32 alphabet false otherwise.

        Returns:

      • encodeBase32URLSafe

        public static byte[] encodeBase32URLSafe(byte[] binaryData)
        Encodes binary data using a URL-safe variation of the base32 algorithm but does not chunk the output. The url-safe variation emits - and _ instead of + and / characters. Note: no padding is added.
        Parameters:
        binaryData - binary data to encode
        Returns:
        byte[] containing Base32 characters in their UTF-8 representation.

      • encodeBase32URLSafeString

        public static String encodeBase32URLSafeString(byte[] binaryData)
        Encodes binary data using a URL-safe variation of the base32 algorithm but does not chunk the output. The url-safe variation emits - and _ instead of + and / characters. Note: no padding is added.
        Parameters:
        binaryData - binary data to encode
        Returns:
        String containing Base32 characters

      • encodeBase32Chunked

        public static byte[] encodeBase32Chunked(byte[] binaryData)
        Encodes binary data using the base32 algorithm and chunks the encoded output into 76 character blocks
        Parameters:
        binaryData - binary data to encode
        Returns:
        Base32 characters chunked in 76 character blocks

      • encodeBase32

        public static byte[] encodeBase32(byte[] binaryData,
                  boolean isChunked)
        Encodes binary data using the base32 algorithm, optionally chunking the output into 76 character blocks.
        Parameters:
        binaryData - Array containing binary data to encode.
        isChunked - if true this encoder will chunk the base32 output into 76 character blocks
        Returns:
        Base32-encoded data.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the input array needs an output array bigger than Integer.MAX_VALUE

      • encodeBase32

        public static byte[] encodeBase32(byte[] binaryData,
                  boolean isChunked,
                  boolean urlSafe)
        Encodes binary data using the base32 algorithm, optionally chunking the output into 76 character blocks.
        Parameters:
        binaryData - Array containing binary data to encode.
        isChunked - if true this encoder will chunk the base32 output into 76 character blocks
        urlSafe - if true this encoder will emit - and _ instead of the usual + and / characters. Note: no padding is added when encoding using the URL-safe alphabet.
        Returns:
        Base32-encoded data.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the input array needs an output array bigger than Integer.MAX_VALUE

      • encodeBase32

        public static byte[] encodeBase32(byte[] binaryData,
                  boolean isChunked,
                  boolean urlSafe,
                  int maxResultSize)
        Encodes binary data using the base32 algorithm, optionally chunking the output into 76 character blocks.
        Parameters:
        binaryData - Array containing binary data to encode.
        isChunked - if true this encoder will chunk the base32 output into 76 character blocks
        urlSafe - if true this encoder will emit - and _ instead of the usual + and / characters. Note: no padding is added when encoding using the URL-safe alphabet.
        maxResultSize - The maximum result size to accept.
        Returns:
        Base32-encoded data.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the input array needs an output array bigger than maxResultSize
